moves.1. e4: The third game from this mini tournament I have annotated and the second against spglenn.
moves.1... c5: After playing the Flohr variation last time I was hoping for a najdorf.
moves.3... Bd7: I played this not checking the Game DB or the opening explorer but because I didn't want to play Nc3 pinning the Knight or Nd7 blocking the Queen and Bishop and Qd7 is just ridiculous.
moves.4. Bxd7+ Qxd7: Still by the book and once again I choose not to go into the opening explorer or Game DB but played because I wanted the flexibality of playing Nc6 rather than Nxd2 which means I have to develop the queen on the a5-d8 diagonal and the Knight is forced into a more defensive square.
moves.7. Be3 Nc6 8. Nc3 e5: !? Blocks the bishop but means chance of a d5 outpost for white as well as a d4 for black
moves.9... Nxd5 10. Bd2: ? gives away a free knight could have played exd5 removes the threat of Nxe3 and attacks the C6 knight
moves.12. b3 Be7 13. c3: Could have closed the queenside with c4
moves.21. Rxg7+ Nxg7 22. Bxh6 Ng4 23. Nf5: Don't exchange when down and also His Bishop is better than mine
Trying to free up the queenside and queen with the a-pawn
moves.31. Nxb4 Kg8 32. g4 f5 33. exf5: Now the Knight sac mate combo begins
moves.33... Ngxf5 34. gxf5 Rxf5 35. Kg2 Rg6+:
White resigns here because Rg4 Rxg4+ Kh3 Rf3# or Kh1 Rf1# or if Kh3 or Kh1 with no Rg4 Rf 1 or 3#

Lessons to learn

Don't exchange when down
Don't create an exchange and not follow through with it
